name: exaggerating
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
exaggerate
C1 to make something seem larger, more important, better, or worse than it really is: The threat of attack has been greatly exaggerated. Don't exaggerate - it wasn't that expensive. I'm not exaggerating - it was the worst meal I've ever eaten in my life. Synonyms
emphasize
foreground
highlight
overplay
overstate
spotlight Opposites
downplay
minimize

More examplesFewer examplesYou shouldn't believe everything she says - she does tend to exaggerate.The minister suggested that some leading environmentalists were exaggerating the issues somewhat.She was a bit annoyed, but she wasn't furious - don't exaggerate.I don't think it would be exaggerating to say that the composer's new work is a masterpiece.He has exaggerated the whole event to make it sound rather more dramatic than it actually was.
